citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A surgeon conducting nephrectomies on two nonhuman primates per an IACUC-approved protocol elected to take off-
protocol liver biopsy samples during the two surgeries. The surgeon had received adequate pre-surgery guidance
regarding the protocol details but disregarded that guidance and conducted the off-protocol biopsies. The animals
experienced no increased pain or distress from the unapproved biopsy procedures based on observations by the
Attending Veterinarian. Conducting procedures without IACUC approval can result in increased harm or death to the
animal and does not afford the IACUC the required regulatory oversight of animal use activities. The regulations state that
the IACUC shall review and approve, require modifications in or withhold approval of proposed significant changes
regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities. Prior to this inspection, the IACUC took appropriate corrective
actions including removing the surgeon from the protocol during the investigation, requiring appropriate protocol
amendments, and increased supervision of the surgeon should they be returned to conducting surgery on this protocol.

A marmoset became entangled in the enrichment hammock in its primary enclosure during the night and was found
deceased at the morning check of the animals. The marmosets and their enclosures had been checked off by animal care
personnel the prior evening with no abnormal findings. The type of hammocks had been in use for three years, were
routinely replaced when damage was observed, and met professionally accepted standards. Not ensuring that primary
enclosures adequately protect the animals can result in injury or death to the animals contained therein. The regulations
state that primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the nonhuman primates from
injury. The IACUC investigated the incident and appropriate corrective actions were taken prior to this inspection including
changing the type of hammocks and enrichment items in the enclosures and increasing frequency of enclosure and
enrichment item checks. Corrective actions to remain in effect from this day forward.
This inspection (Feb 26-27, 2025) and exit interview (Feb 27, 2025) were conducted with facility representatives.
